item.title: Libya’s Sufi Character Cannot Be Erased
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rghebi
item.description: Multiple attacks on Sufi religious and historical sites last week highlight two threats to Libya’s democratic transition: Islamic extremism and the failure of the government to take action. On 25 August, Salafist extremists destroyed a Sufi shrine and library in Zlitan. item.title: Global Unrest Ushers in New Crises of Representation: Assessing the Present and Future of Area Studies
item.dc:creator: barazaonline
item.description: The global wave of protests presently underway has ushered in a new crisis in the interdisciplinary field of area studies. item.dc:creator: Sahar Ullah
item.description: Libya’s “African Mercenaries” from Baraza Video on Vimeo. item.title: Libyan Media: In Chaos or Right Where it Should Be?
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rghebi
item.description: After 42 years under the tight grip of Muammar al-Gaddafi, Libya is not only experiencing a political revolution but also a media revolution.
